Buddha-Bar Hotel Budapest Klotild Palace
8.8 Excellent
Based on 144 reviews

This brand new 5-star hotel say they are aiming even higher than 5 stars..They success! The interior gives a unique atmosphere that is connected to the famous restaurant and bar.

The breakfast, roomservice and not at least the dinner in the restaurant is simply delicious. Servispeople are on spot to help out at all times. We did not try out the spa(The prices for the treatments are quite high compeared to what you can get elsewhere in Budapest). We were lucky and got to spend 3 nights at this fantastic hotel included breakfast for only about 440 Euro in total for 2 persons! A lot for the money! (Compared for what we get home in Norway..). 23. October is the National Day of Hungary, and people gathered right outside the hotel for speaches and television, marking the day. The hotel lefs a letter in our room the day before, informing about this. The crowds were calm, and we experience the Hungarian people as very friendly and calm. A moment to remember was when they played the National Anthem, and we where inside the hotel that afternoon, hearing the people sing. Beautiful! The only negative is that the have a constructionary proble that the water from the shower is floating out on the bathroomfloor. This is under work.

Show more
Gina , Norway
7Seasons Apartments Budapest
8.9 Excellent
Based on 355 reviews

I am someone who doesn't write bad reviews but here it is a must.I recently stayed 16 nights in room 505 bloc B, pretty calm except noisy neighbors.

Day 1 wanted to use the washing machine of course it didn't work, i didn't complain much there is a place where you can do laundry downstairs. Day 2 : Insects in the bathroom, so i didn't make a big deal about it and got rid of it. Day 3 : Insects again near bed, and now i complained asked for new bedding for 3 times, every time they say yes and then of course they didn't change them, so the 4th day i complained also got few nods and nothing happened ,at one point i felt they didn't understand what that kind of insect is is, eventually they treated the ground with a product. Bedding: -The bed is uncomfortable IKEA bed, that makes noises by just moving in or turning from side to side. which kind of broke on day 13 and a handy man came in to fix it Pillows 50 x 50 cm you can find in IKEA for 2-3 euro each. The mat is very soft would so it might be a problem for people with back pain. Quality of sleep, if those were not enough, the curtains can 't stop the day light from coming in outside even when closed, In 16 nights stay, i got only 2 times change of bedding apparently as they claim Hungary law states that bedding changes once on the 6th day as they claim i am sure that s the least requirement and of course as low cost as they are they would go for that. One day i asked for a change of bedding, they said i want more then change it once every 6 days i have to pay for that change. Moving on the CLEANING, by no mean i blame the cleaning ladies, in 16 th days i took picture of 1 cm thickness of dust in few places stayed there for my entire stay. The bad cleaning comes from the agency that runs this place, low cost i think the cleaners have to do the cleaning very fast , minimal cleaning. The apartments aren t always close to one another so they have to do a lot of jumping between blocs and floors so cleanin

Show more
YACOUB , Lebanon
Continental Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 137 reviews

we moved to this hotel after a 3 night stay in another 4 start luxury hotel from a well know chain. no comparison.

the details in the room the quality of the huge bathroom, the mazing level of cleanliness made for a terrific experience. one little treasure hidden in the hotel is the restaurant. while the breakfast looked really good but ordinary high chain hotel style (one of the good one) where things got to a really different level was the restaurant. we tried 8 top restaurants in town. one on the river that we loved, the italian one just across the street (amazing food average pizza ... i am italian and i should know right!) and the restaurant callas just opposite to the opera house, our favorite for food quality was without a doubt the restaurant within the hotel, perhaps not in terms of atmosphere ... a bit cold and impersonal but clearly with a luxurious feel, the food was better than anything else we tried and ..... much cheaper ... dont be tempted by the lunch menu good and dirty cheap but not worth it i think when compared to the selection you have for just a little more

Show more
francesco , Italy
Corinthia Hotel Budapest
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 220 reviews

We had a glorious stay at the Corinithian. The grandeur and magnificence of the building was impressive.

The staff was immediately welcoming, and helpful, cordial and friendly, in all respects, throughout our 3 day stay. The gave us an umbrella for our use for one day that was a bit rainy. The gave us a converter for our "American" plugs. A magnificent breakfast---the best I can recall in any hotel in the world. Accomodating and professional wait staff---well-dressed and quite effective and pleasant. The hotel offered an early bird breakfast (4:30 A.M.- 6:30), small and limited, but which we enjoyed and for which we were grateful the last day there, since we had an early flight. The spa and pool were great and the pool espeically beautiful and grand. The gym, while small, had weight and stengthening machines much better than most hotels. We had a complimentary upgrade from a standard room, to wonderful spacious two-bedroom, fully equipped apartment with living room, dining room, full kitchen. Plus, we had a price, through Agoda, that was remarkable. For a 5-star, top end experience that we enjoyed, this was a bargain. We could not have been more pleased. The stay here was outstanding, and we were delighted. Allen E. Hench Charlottesville, Virginia

Show more
Allen , United States
Prestige Hotel Budapest
9.3 Exceptional
Based on 90 reviews

The staff here is friendly, helpful, and thoughtful. All of the staff that we encountered were well trained and very polished.

The rooms were beautiful and spotless, as was the rest of the hotel. The extra little touches were very much appreciated as this was the final city of our very busy travels and we were becoming weary. The location was excellent. We walked everywhere. This hotel is not far from anything we wanted to see but down a side street that was very quiet. It is just around the corner from an area full of restaurants and cafes. My 18 and 22 year old daughters gave me a "gold star" for booking this hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Budapest.

Show more
Sandra , Canada
Kempinski Hotel Corvinus Budapest
9 Excellent
Based on 165 reviews

We stayed at the Kempinski in July 2011. A lovely hotel. Our room was great, even though it was two twin beds, but we didn't mind so much.

The beds were very comfortable, the bathrooms were lovely, the room was large. Our view wasn't that great, as it was to the courtyard in the back, but it wasn't bad. We didn't spend much time in the hotel at all. It was close to some good shopping and close to most of the major tourist sites. A hop on hop off bus stop is around the corner and so is the metro. but budapest is pretty small, so you don't really need to use the public transportation that much. Cons. Not on the river, which would have been ideal. It was a short walk away though. The pool was tiny. The gym was also tiny and limited, but the machines were top quality though. Breakfast was very very price. 25 euros per person. We just went to the california coffee house in front of st stephen's basilica and had a big breakfast for 16 euros for two people. Otherwise it was a fantastic stay and i would recommend the hotel to anyone. Also, there's a Nobu in the hotel.

Show more
Omar , United States
Zenit Budapest Palace
8.8 Excellent
Based on 159 reviews

This hotel is a must for travellers, especially those whose first language is English. The reception staff are exceptional and a special thanks to Sara, Balint and Zoltan (Zo Zo) for making our trip to Budapest memorable.

In terms of value for money, this hotel offers good rates at 4 star level, particularly if you book early. Rooms are spacious and clean and all amenities are well catered for including laundry. The restaurant serves a very hearty breakfast and this Canberra included in the room rate if you book early. We would make this a definite place to stay again.

Show more
John , Australia
Hotel President
8.2 Excellent
Based on 376 reviews

The stay was pleasant despite the fact that the staff at the rooftop bar was relatively unfriendly and had no service-mind.

The room was small but very practical and the bed was comfortable. We had a wonderful breakfast, lots of choices from tasty warm and cold selections, the staffs at the breakfast room were very thoughtful, attentive and friendly. There is a wellness club and swimming pool at the Basement of the hotel, but with our booking, we were't entitled to use them, or unless we pay around EUR 15,- per person per day, which we found it, ridiculous for the guest to pay such amount to enter to the swimming pool at the hotel. The receptionists were helpful, though some speak little English, they tried much and put lots of efforts for us, so that we had an enjoyable stay in Budapest, thanks to the young receptionist girl, who were very friendly and attentive. About the location, we love it, the hotel located at the prime-business location of Budapest, very safe area to walk at night and all day long, only less than 2 minutes to US Embassy and a few minutes walk to the Metro Station and less than 10 minutes to Parliament House. Overall we are fairly happy with our stay at The President Hotel. Personally, we rate this hotel 3.5 stars.

Show more
Utsapaporn , Thailand
Sofitel Budapest Hotel
8.7 Excellent
Based on 89 reviews

Very good stay. Lovely room - just a pity no view of the Danube. Attentive staff - one day, I was unwell and needed a chemist - I was shown where to go - later that day, the same porter came over and asked how I was feeling - and gave me some complimentary Vitamin 'c' from the spa !!! So sweet !!! Only one downside - our last day ans our flight was not until 6.

30. The first check in guy said he thought we could stay in our room until late afternoon, but on checking with his supervisor, she was very abrupt and said we couldn't sat in our room as they were fully booked. That's fine, but she was dismissive and did not offer any other suggestion or even a place where we might change/freshen up later in the day. oh well - the rest of the stay was good. One last thing - the breakfast was VERY expensive. Much better to go out of the hotel to the local square and have breakfast in a cafe.

Show more
Sally , United Kingdom
Estilo Fashion Hotel Budapest
8.5 Excellent
Based on 69 reviews

We stayed in the Estilo hotel for a couple of days late August. Our stay was great in all respect. We really liked the interior of the place, modern and cozy at the same time.

Everytime we dealt with the reception we were handled in a friendly and professional manner. The location of the hotel is great - within walking distance to many of the city's great landmarks, yet on a quieter part of famous Vaci Utca. The breakfast buffet was just right. At the beginning we were afraid we would have to wait in a queue for the breakfast as the nice looking hotel's restaurant seems fairly small but it never happened to us during our 3 days stay. I am thinking of anything to complain about but cannot find anything.

Show more
Dagmara , United Kingdom
La Prima Fashion Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 177 reviews

although we arrived earlier then 1 pm our room was ready to check in. the reception staff was very friendly (peter) and efficient.

we got room 203 which was very light and spacious, the windows double glazed. cool big mirror and the tv was built in the mirror. bed huge and extremely comfortable. there was a safe in the room, big enough for your laptop and with a plug inside, thus you can charge your laptop whilst inside. the bathroom was great with bath tube. i absolutely loved the floor heating in there! we also liked the breakfast. various bread rolls, toaster, scrambled eggs with and without sausages, cooked paprika, choice of cheese, ham (pork, turkey and chicken) freshly baked sweet pastries (chocolate flavoured and simple croissant) fresh fruit: kiwi, mandarine, apple, grapes and the usual staff, musli, jam, honey, yoghurt at the end of our stay we were able to leave our luggage in the hotel in a locked room for a couple of hours - which was very useful. all in all we had a great time in this hotel and i would book it again.

Show more
Gabriella , Hungary
InterContinental Budapest
8.8 Excellent
Based on 101 reviews

My friend and I spent two nights in this hotel. We traveled from Prague to here . Budapest was not that good comparing to Intercontinental which was loacted by the river.

So I ended up choosing the location and I deeply hope the service of intercontinental would also nice. Unfortuntely , I was totally wrong !! The reception and concierge were not that friendly and helpful. It looked like a business hotel! I did borrow the adapter and the brought it up in the room with the letter saying that if I didn't return it we will charge XX . I've been travelling around the world both pleasure and on business and also I had a chance to stay in many 5* hotels both in Europe and Asia . I never experinced the hotel sending me the letter about the charge of the charger. This is very little thing that could bring about the bad impression to come back to this hotel again

Show more
Ananda , Thailand
NH Budapest City
8.7 Excellent
Based on 173 reviews

We just stayed one night but would have stayed many. It was a very easy check-in. I emailed to aske about airport transport, and while they do not have a shuttle gave me the link for the airport shuttle which was easy and only $12 for two people.

The room was very comfortable with a nice plush bed and a minibar. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel (only because it was not included) but they do offer a breakfast if you would like to eat there. we chose to eat at a local coffee shop just at the end of the street for great food/coffee and very cheap. Because we were only there one night we did not take advantage of the pool or gym either. The hotel is about a 5-10 minute walk from the Parliament and the river. I would recommend this hotel to others for short or long stays.

Show more
Margaret , United States
Eurostars Budapest Center
8.6 Excellent
Based on 335 reviews

This was one of the best hotels I've ever visited. I'd chosen it for its high rates in online travel services and I wasn't disappointed.

The rooms were cosy, nicely decorated with a modern feeling, and quite roomy. Room service was also very good. One of the greatest aspects of this hotel, other than its services and friendly stuff, is its location; it sits two blocks from the Danube river, and just one block from the start of the venerable Vaci street. It's also very well connected, with bus and metro stations right across the street, and a tram station one block away. My only strife was with the hotel's WiFi; the signal in my room was too low and the network kept disconnecting. The hotel stuff provided me with a UTP cable, but it turned out that either the cable was bad or the RJ45 plug was dead. On the other hand, the signal was quite good in the hotel lobby and restaurant/cafeteria. Another minor shortcoming was that the room windows had no shutters but just light curtains and rooms from the two wings of the hotel were facing each other.

Show more
Nikolaos , Greece
artotel Budapest
8.8 Excellent
Based on 123 reviews

Location is in front of the River of Budapest and In front of the parliament building, the room conditions are fine and well set up, the room is spacious, unfortunately the AC is not working properly (zero) i could say.

we told the employee to about it and nothing happened after, we actually moved to somewhere else and we glad we made it move. Overall, it's good for the price.

Show more
Mark , United States
Boscolo Budapest - Autograph Collection Hotel
8.8 Excellent
Based on 139 reviews

Well we had arranged to be picked up at the airport. All confirmed and told that a man would be there with a card with our names on.

We'd been looking forward to that after a long trip, but got there and no one was there!! Went to information area and they rang hotel for us (for a fee of course, not that small either!) and when I spoke to the hotel they were very short and said that they weren't sending a car and I should get a taxi. I was livid!! But get to the hotel and they say that due to the confusion over the transport they have upgraded the room we are in. Went up to the room and they had left birthday cake (I'd advised them before we were there for a birthday) and the room - OH MY GOD! It was big! Think it was a junior suite. The bathroom was nearly the size of my house!! After that I couldn't fault the service. The woman in the bar was very friendly. The piano man played well (and being a pianist that's unusual for me to say!). The breakfast was good, except don't eat the sausages - yuck! But the champagne finishes off breakfast quite nicely! The dining room is very ornate and I loved it. Had a massage while there - that was very good - apart from having to get changed into a towel and then walk past the mens changing room! Swimming pool, had seating along one side with Jacuzzi along that side, but it is shallow, and initially when I walked in there it felt a bit claustrophobic, but once in the pool it was quite nice. The gym - good equipment that is all modern. Overall I did like the hotel, just a shame about the mishap at the start, although it worked out in our favour in the long run.

Show more
Natalie , United Kingdom
Bo33 Hotel Family and Suites
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 40 reviews

This is a brilliant modern hotel with great features to suit everyone, rooms are spacious, clean and have great facilities, staff are fantastic and polite, with great knowledge of the city, the bar is also 24hr if you wanted to stay in for the night and have a few drinks.

Also the city centre is around 15-20 mins walk depending on your speed, but either way very accesible and no need to waste money on a taxi, although they are easy to come by if you wanted one.

Show more
Laurence , United Kingdom
Queen's Court Hotel & Residence
8.4 Excellent
Based on 102 reviews

The Queen's Court Hotel is a nice, quiet place with nice big suites (we had a Superior Suite rather than a Standard).

The pool & sauna area were quite small but that's all you really need for a hotel of this size. The staff were welcoming and polite although we weren't offered any assistance with our bags, which surprised me. Not that I would have taken them up on the offer if they had as we had very light luggage but most places would at least ask if you needed some help. The room itself was a very nice standard but wasn't luxurious, as you would expect for a 5 star property. Perhaps the more expensive suites would feel a bit more upmarket. All in all, I'd say it's a 4 - 4.5 star hotel. We were travelling to Budapest for my birthday and when we returned to our room in the afternoon, the front desk staff had left a bottle of wine & a note, which was a really nice touch. If you're looking for somewhere nice & quiet to rest in the evening but isn't very far from the entertainment district, then this is the place to go. Compared to other hotels of a similar standard I think we got a very good deal. We got a very good room for our money and wouldn't hesitate to recommend the hotel to others.

Show more
Samantha , Australia
Mercure Budapest Korona Hotel
7.9 Very good
Based on 91 reviews

Booked a twin room under children under 12 stay free for 2 adults and 2 children. Pleasant surprise: big room and 2 extra beds at no charge.

Clean room and bathroom, very nice breakfast. Note: while there, buffet breakfast was served in two adjacent spaces. Same choice, however one of them had the so called called "hungarian corner" with some extra yummy stuff. Location is great: we had a great view onto Kalvin ter, the church and the museums garden, all at once - had a corner room. Easy walk through to the Vasarcsarnok (old central markets), Gellert baths and all the way up to Lanchid. Great public transport connection: 2 metro lines, trams 47 and 49 at the door, ram 2 at 5 minutes walk.

Show more
szilard , Australia
Danubius Hotel Gellert
7.6 Very good
Based on 234 reviews

My visit to Budapest was the end of a four week tour of Cyprus, Italy, Croatia and Hungary. I stayed at the Danubius Hotel as a bit of a reward (it was the most expensive accommodation during my trip) after spending four weeks at home stays, B & B's, small privately owned hotels, etc.

.........I wish I hadn't. The hotel its self was okay, but Budapest was the most horrible place I have ever visited (I've travelled to over 45 countries). The locals were emotionally stunted and obviously did not like tourists. I met some nice Hungarians, but they were few and far between. By far the nicest people were the other tourists. Budapest is a very sad city. All I felt was pity for them. Go and visit and see for yourself. I will never go back. Do yourself a favour and spend your tourist dollar elsewhere. 8.4 Excellent

Location: The hotel has been located alongside the River Danube which is only 3min walk from the metro station.

It is right opposite to the Parliment - with stunning night view like a golden palace. There are also a couple of bus and tram routes which may carry tourists around. If you want to get to the uphill tram station to the palace, just 10-15min walk and you will be there. There are also a couple of small restaurants and mini markets nearby, though choices maybe limited. Price: Reasonably priced given we took the early bird offer - we have not checked the normal rates, though. Rooms: Rooms are clean and pretty spacious with required facilities. Other facities: Only one sauna room is available. For tourists who are not used to having sauna with opposite sex, you may need to give it up. Fitness room is a relatively small one with basic equipments. Service: Staff has been nice, friendly and helpful. English is not a problem at the reception desk but other staff (e.g. housekeepers) may not know English. Overall, this has been a well-located hotel of reasonable price.

We stayed here for three nights and found the location and apartments hotel brilliant. The value for money was excellent.

We got a double room on the 3rd floor. The staff were very friendly and helped whenever we had questions. We had a dinner in the restaurant near by there which was delicious and averagely priced. The room was an average size, with a clean and tidy bathroom. We had free internet on an overly complicated TV/computer, (definitely a manual reader to get working). The location of the apartment was excellent and it was easy to walk to the many sites from there (we never used any transport while we were in the city). Just over the road is the Market hall, it’s huge and definitely worth popping in. Just down the road is Kalvin ter metro, from here you can easily get the tube to Kobanya-Kispest and the 200E bus to the airport, which was easy to do and cost about 2 pounds each. I would definitely say at this hotel and again and recommend to family.

The sofa bed was arched up in the middle meaning my head was lower than my body even with the 2 pillows it was far too uncomfortable to sleep. We asked for an airport transfer, I said we needed to be at the airport 2 hours before our flight but the man who checked us in insisted we didn't need that much time and had pre booked our transfer with no room for manoeuvre on the time, we only just made our flight in time as the queues in the airport check in, security and immigration were long and slow. We could have very easily missed our flight due to having our transfer booked far too late. If you book a transfer then please insist on leaving early, don't take no for an answer. There was a problem with homeless vacating their bladders in the entrance to the apartment block, off putting to say the least. We were so excited to stay here as the previous reviews were so good but I would definitely not stay here again. Budapest is a must-see for the serious traveller in Europe. Often missed because of the fact that it is a little off the beaten path, it is city worth going the extra distance to experience.

The people are very friendly and helpful and genuinely put forth the effort to make you feel welcome in their city. You don't have to go far out of your way at all to find something interesting to do. Just walking down the historical streets and pedestrian-only alleyways and parks can fill an entire day. There are seemingly an unlimited choice of great restaurants, cafes, bars, and bakeries to enjoy the local cuisine. The food is a real treat and there is a large variety of items to try. The city is incredibly photogenic so have your camera ready! It's almost harder to decide what NOT to take a photo of.

More about Budapest

Hungary's ancient capital, Budapest is rich in history, stunning architecture, and a vibrant culture. Budapest is served by Ferihegy International Airport which is located east of Budapest and connected to the city by train, bus, or taxi.

Budapest is divided into two parts; Buda on the western and Pest on the eastern banks of the Danube River. Both sides are easily accessible by metro, tram, bus, and water taxi. Budapest budget hotels and five-star luxury hotels can be found on both sides of the river. Older, more affordable hotels are predominantly in Buda, while modern high-end hotels are more likely to be found in Pest.

The Royal Palaceis one of the most popular attractions, located on top of the suitably named Castle Hill. After exploring the palace, don't miss a visit to the National Museum and enjoy a coffee on the terrace. A popular outdoor activity is a visit to the Labyrinth, which was formed by natural hot springs and transformed into a raid shelter during World War II.

Shopping is available all over the city and tends to be more quaint in Pest, while the more modern shops are found in Buda. After a long day of shopping and sightseeing, unwind at one of Hungary's traditional bath houses.

Dinning in Budapest is full of many exciting options, and it's an experience not to be missed. Pest is home to the famous Great Market Hall, a large area where small traditional eateries can be found and where locals and travelers can enjoy a hearty meal.

There’s much more to see and learn about Budapest, and the interactive map is a great way to continue exploring all the important landmarks and attractions of this vibrant city.

Budapest is served by Ferihegy International Airport which is located east of Budapest and connected to the city by train, bus, or taxi. Budapest is divided into two parts; Buda on the western and Pest on the eastern banks of the Danube River. Both sides are easily accessible by metro, tram, bus, and water taxi. Budapest budget hotels and five-star luxury hotels can be found on both sides of the river. Older, more affordable hotels are predominantly in Buda, while modern high-end hotels are more likely to be found in Pest. The Royal Palace is one of the most popular attractions, located on top of the suitably named Castle Hill. After exploring the palace, don't miss a visit to the National Museum and enjoy a coffee on the terrace. A popular outdoor activity is a visit to the Labyrinth, which was formed by natural hot springs and transformed into a raid shelter during World War II. Shopping is available all over the city and tends to be more quaint in Pest, while the more modern shops are found in Buda. After a long day of shopping and sightseeing, unwind at one of Hungary's traditional bath houses. Dinning in Budapest is full of many exciting options, and it's an experience not to be missed. Pest is home to the famous Great Market Hall, a large area where small traditional eateries can be found and where locals and travelers can enjoy a hearty meal. There’s much more to see and learn about Budapest, and the interactive map is a great way to continue exploring all the important landmarks and attractions of this vibrant city.
